question: A head-target (e.g., artesian flowing well) MNW setup computes discharge based primarily on which head difference?
success: ✅ Correct. Free flow is governed by the head difference Δh = ($h_{lim}$ - $h_{aq}$) respectively Δh = ($h_{well}$ - $h_{aq}$) assuming that the well head equals the limiting head.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Recall that the controlling head is the aquifer head relative to the limiting head, not the other way around.

question: When does the computed discharge Q become zero for a flowing-well (head-target) configuration?
success: ✅ Correct. If $h_{aq}$ ≤ $h_{lim}$, Δh = 0 and MNW returns Q = 0 regardless of the desired rate.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Q is nonzero only when the aquifer head equals or exceeds the limiting head.

question: How does increasing the limiting head $h_{lim}$ affect the Q–h curve for a fixed CWC parameter set?
success: ✅ Correct. A higher $h_{lim}$ reduces Δh for a given $h_{aq}$, reducing the flow. Besides, the shape of the curve remains the same.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Raising $h_{lim}$ reduces, not increases, Δh at fixed $h_{aq}$.

question: Which changes in CWC parameters tend to make the MNW response more linear in Δh (i.e., closer to proportional Q–Δh)?
success: ✅ Correct. Dominant linear terms (aquifer/skin; A & B term) with C ≈ 0 (independent of P) yield a near-linear Q–Δh.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Nonlinear (turbulent) losses occur with C > 0 and are increased with larger values of P > 1.

question: In a head-target scenario with a very large desired withdrawal, which factor typically limits the feasible Q returned by MNW?
success: ✅ Correct. With head targeting, the feasible Q is governed by Δh and the CWC relation, not by the requested rate.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. The desired rate is only a request; MNW computes what is feasible given Δh and losses.

question: How does the existence of nonlinear losses influence the discharge–drawdown curve? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Nonlinear resistance, parameterized by _C_ and _P_ in _CWC_ affects when the limiting head is reached.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Nonlinear losses are central to curve shape and influences when the threshold-limiting Q is reached.
